sourceMeaningMnemonic: Your <radical>roof</radical> needs <radical>measurement</radical>s done every year to make sure it will <kanji>protect</kanji> you properly.
meaningInfo: If you think about it, your roof protects you from a lot of things! Rain, snow, bird poop. But if your roof's measurements are off it won't be able to protect you properly.
readingMnemonic: If the measurements are off, and your roof doesn't <kanji>protect</kanji> you, then you get to <reading>sue</reading> (<ja>す</ja>)! If you're still alive, that is.
readingInfo: Odds are, the roof collapsed or a tree fell on you and you died from lack of protection. So now your family and friends are going to sue on your behalf.
